channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mental exercise can reverse a brain change linked to aging, study finds
item.description: Scientists have found the first compelling evidence that cognitive training can boost levels of a brain chemical that typically declines as people age...

item.title: VP Vance tries to progress Gaza ceasefire. And, White House demolition draws critics
item.description: Vice President JD Vance is in Israel to address challenges in the Gaza ceasefire. And, the demolition of the East Wing of the White House has drawn cr...

item.title: The federal government is still shut down. Here's what that means across the country
item.description: The federal government remains shut down. The NPR Network is following the ways the shutdown is affecting services across the country.

item.title: Trump uses 'common sense' to make a political point. It has populist appeal
item.description: The phrase appeals more to several demographics that strongly align with Trump, says Republican strategist Frank Luntz, including older voters, for wh...

item.title: Mamdani's rise in NYC reflects generational fight within the Democratic Party
item.description: Newcomer Zohran Mamdani, age 34, has used social media and big progressive ideas to shoulder past Andrew Cuomo, who's 67 and long a member of Democrat...

item.title: UN's top court says Israel obliged to allow UN aid into Gaza
item.description: The court also says Israel has not substantiated its allegations against the UN agency for Palestinian refugees.

item.title: Dozens killed in Nigeria fuel tanker explosion
item.description: People rushed to collect fuel from the overturned tanker when it suddenly exploded, engulfing them in flames.

item.title: Government shutdown becomes second-longest in history on Day 22
item.description: The government shutdown is now the second-longest funding lapse in modern history, stretching into Day 22 on Wednesday. Follow live updates here.

item.title: Sen. Jeff Merkley delivers marathon speech protesting Trump's policies
item.description: Democratic Sen. Jeff Merkley began delivering a marathon speech Tuesday evening, speaking overnight and into the morning Wednesday in protest of Presi...

item.title: UN's top court says Israel obliged to allow UN aid into Gaza
item.description: The court also says Israel has not substantiated its allegations against the UN agency for Palestinian refugees.

item.title: School in Sweden locked down after suspected hand grenades discovered
item.description: Swedish media say a school attended by about 800 students was locked down after two suspected grenades were found nearby.

item.title: Democratic senator gives marathon speech ahead of 12th vote on funding bill
item.description: The Senate is set to vote for a 12th time to reopen the government as the shutdown becomes the second-longest funding lapse in U.S. history. Before th...

item.title: Group of unlikely allies seeking ban on AI "superintelligence"
item.description: There arfe many big names in a group of unlikely allies seeking a ban, for now, on AI "superintelligence" they say could threaten humanity.

item.title: SpaceX says it has cut Starlink services to Myanmar scam camps
item.description: Campaigners say Starlink technology has enabled crime syndicates to operate from locations along the Thai-Myanmar border.

item.title: Eight pupils suspended after video shows assault at South African school
item.description: The mother of one of the assault victims says he is a cancer survivor, according to reports.

item.title: Task force aims to move those displaced by ex-typhoon in Alaska from shelters to hotels, rentals

item.title: In Chicago, an immense show of force signals a sharp escalation in White House immigration crackdown
